item.description:

In our experience, many organizations find it appropriate to...

item.title: Navigating the TOGAF® Standard, 10th Edition: Updates and Insights (Source: blog.opengroup.org)
item.description:
By Andrew Josey, VP, Standards & Certification, The Open Group

The TOGAF® Standard,10th Edition was introduced in April 2022, and expanded the material available to architecture practitioners making adoption of best practices easier. This article gives a roundup of the latest changes to the standard since its introduction, and the ecosystem around it.

Continue reading

The post Navigating the TOGAF® Standard, 10th Edition: Updates and Insights first appeared on The Open Group Blog.

item.description:
By Ash Patel – CDMP – Certified Copywriter (CMP) - CDMA, Marketing Specialist, The Open Group

In this enlightening episode, we dive into the world of leadership, resilience, and cultural nuances with Roberto Severo, Country Manager for The Open Group in Brazil, Colombia, and Peru. Roberto's journey in the IT industry is a testament to the power of adaptation and the importance of understanding cultural dynamics.

Continue reading

The post Open Comments Rewind: Collaborative Evolution Shaping Industry Standards with Roberto Severo first appeared on The Open Group Blog.

item.title: The Open Group Summit Highlights – Amsterdam, – May 19 – 22, 2025 (Source: blog.opengroup.org)
item.description:
By Ash Patel - CDMP - Certified Copywriter (CMP) – CDMA, Marketing Specialist,  The Open Group

The Open Group Summit took place at the Amsterdam Congress Center, bringing together over 470 attendees including distinguished experts, visionary industry leaders, and seasoned practitioners from diverse fields including AI, Sustainability, Digital Transformation, and Ecosystems Architecture. As next-generation AI technologies redefine the boundaries of possibility, R&D-driven organizations are channelling significant resources into developing advanced foundation models while technology providers focus on embedding AI into transformative end-user applications.

Continue reading

The post The Open Group Summit Highlights – Amsterdam, – May 19 – 22, 2025 first appeared on The Open Group Blog.

item.title: Exciting Updates for the Open FAIR™ Body of Knowledge and Certification Program (Source: blog.opengroup.org)
item.description:
By John Linford, Security Portfolio Director, The Open Group, and Corinne Brouch, Director Learning and Certifications, The Open Group.
Since the publication of the NIST Cybersecurity Framework (CSF), Version 2.0, the Security Forum has been working to understand the implications of changes to the CSF and making changes to The Open Group Open FAIR™ Body of Knowledge to ensure consistency with the changes.

Continue reading

The post Exciting Updates for the Open FAIR™ Body of Knowledge and Certification Program first appeared on The Open Group Blog.

item.title: Celebrating Milestones: The Open Group FACE® Consortium at 15 and The Open Group SOSA® Consortium at 10 (Source: blog.opengroup.org)
item.description:
By Ash Patel – CDMP – Certified Copywriter (CMP) - CDMA, Marketing Specialist, The Open Group

Innovation and collaboration have long driven progress in the aerospace and defense sectors, shaping the technologies and practices that ensure safety, efficiency, and interoperability. This year marks two significant anniversaries that exemplify these principles: the 15th anniversary of The Open Group FACE® Consortium and the 10th anniversary of The Open Group SOSA® Consortium. These milestones offer an opportunity to reflect on their journeys, achievements, and the collective future they promise.

Continue reading

The post Celebrating Milestones: The Open Group FACE® Consortium at 15 and The Open Group SOSA® Consortium at 10 first appeared on The Open Group Blog.

item.description:
By Ash Patel – CDMP – Certified Copywriter (CMP) - CDMA, Marketing Specialist, The Open Group

Navigating a career change from the arts to the analytical world of IT and cybersecurity can seem daunting. Yet, John Feezell’s journey exemplifies that with the right mix of passion and continuous learning, such transitions can lead to mastery and leadership in the new field.

Continue reading

The post Open Comments Rewind: Charting a Course from Music to Cybersecurity Mastery with John Feezell first appeared on The Open Group Blog.

item.title: Achieving Business Goals While Safeguarding Your Data (Source: blog.opengroup.org)
item.description:
Modern organizations today rely heavily on data to keep their businesses running. Many times, they may not even realize just how much information flows internally and through third parties to maintain ongoing efficiency. From finance departments and product development teams to sales and marketing, access to data is fundamental for making critical decisions and driving operations.

Continue reading

The post Achieving Business Goals While Safeguarding Your Data first appeared on The Open Group Blog.

item.title: Earth Day and Enabling the Shift to Clean Energy through Standards (Source: blog.opengroup.org)
item.description:
By Jim Hietala, VP, Sustainability and Market Development

This year's Earth Day theme is "Our Power, Our Planet". The goal is to help accelerate the global generation and availability of clean energy, including renewable energy sources such as solar, wind, hydroelectric, geothermal, and tidal.

Continue reading

The post Earth Day and Enabling the Shift to Clean Energy through Standards first appeared on The Open Group Blog.

item.title: Open Comments Rewind: Navigating the Oil and Gas Industry With AI and Real-Time Data (Source: blog.opengroup.org)
item.description:
By Ash Patel – CDMP – Certified Copywriter (CMP), Marketing Specialist, The Open Group

The oil and gas industry stands on the brink of a transformation, and data standards are the linchpins in this evolutionary phase. Pablo Perez of the Energistics® Consortium, an affiliate of The Open Group, provides a riveting conversation on our podcast, taking listeners from his early days in Venezuela to the pivotal role he plays in shaping data communication and transfer within the sector.

Continue reading

The post Open Comments Rewind: Navigating the Oil and Gas Industry With AI and Real-Time Data first appeared on The Open Group Blog.

item.title: Innovation at The Open Group: A Legacy of Leadership (Source: blog.opengroup.org)
item.description:
By Ash Patel – CDMP – Certified Copywriter (CMP), Marketing Specialist, The Open Group

For decades, The Open Group has been an innovation leader, providing globally recognized standards, tools, and frameworks that help organizations turn ideas into actionable strategies. Milestones like the TOGAF® Standard, a Standard of The Open Group and the ArchiMate® Modeling Language have redefined Enterprise Architecture, enabling organizations to design and implement transformative systems effectively.

Continue reading

The post Innovation at The Open Group: A Legacy of Leadership first appeared on The Open Group Blog.

item.title: The Open Group at the Reading Museum DIGITAL Revolution Exhibition (Source: blog.opengroup.org)
item.description:
By Oliver David, Marketing Manager, The Open Group.

The Open Group participated in the DIGITAL Revolution exhibition at the Reading Museum, celebrating the 60th anniversary of Reading's transformation into a digital hub.

The exhibition opened to the public Tuesday, March 18 and runs until December 24, 2025. It honors the town's incredible tech journey, starting with the arrival of Digital Equipment Corporation (DEC) in the town in 1964, and highlights its lasting impact on the region’s ICT industry.

Continue reading

The post The Open Group at the Reading Museum DIGITAL Revolution Exhibition first appeared on The Open Group Blog.

item.title: Training Architects Has Never Been So Important — Here’s Why (Source: www.forrester.com)
item.description: Many enterprise architecture teams are unable to scale their impact or evolve their practices due to a growing skills gap. Learn the three distinct but interconnected dimensions of training that high-performing EA teams invest in.

item.title: M-Files Embeds Itself More Deeply Into The Microsoft Ecosystem (Source: www.forrester.com)
item.description: Find out how M-Files’ deepening of its partnership with Microsoft will impact customers and the overall enterprise content management market.

item.title: Factories, Foundries, Or Refineries? Seeking The Right Metaphor For Agentic AI (Source: www.forrester.com)
item.description: The critical question facing enterprise architects: How will you evolve your practice to manage AI’s inherent ambiguity, address human concerns around AI adoption, and architect systems that capture and leverage tacit knowledge?

item.title: Architecture Executive Dashboard: Aligning Business Leaders With EA (Source: www.leanix.net)
item.description: A key challenge for enterprise architects has always been achieving alignment between their business leaders and the aims, priorities, and progress of their work. To support you with this, we're introducing Architecture Executive Dashboards directly within SAP LeanIX.

item.title: Enterprise Architecture Today: Perception, Reality, and Opportunity [SURVEY] (Source: www.leanix.net)
item.description: Investment in enterprise architecture (EA) has increased over the last two years. That’s what 64% of respondents to a recently published survey by SAP LeanIX–EA Insights 2025–found. That’s good news and suggests that more and more companies have begun to recognize the of value effective enterprise architecture management.

item.title: SAP LeanIX GitHub Integration: Visibility On Self-Built Software (Source: www.leanix.net)
item.description: Do you have visibility on the software your business builds? Leverage our out-of-the-box GitHub integration to complete your map of your IT landscape.

item.title: AI Agents and Omnipresent AI: How SAP LeanIX and WalkMe Unleash Business AI (Source: www.leanix.net)

item.description: What is SAP LeanIX? Watch Sam Masri sit down with LeanIX co-founder, André Christ, to go back to basics on what LeanIX is and what the future holds now it's part of SAP.

item.title: Enterprise Architecture Data Quality With Calculations (Source: www.leanix.net)
item.description: Enterprise architecture data quality is key for achieving data-driven insight into your IT landscape. Leverage the new calculations feature in SAP LeanIX to spare manual effort and improve data consistency.

item.title: Diagram To Data: Leveraging AI’s Greatest Capability (Source: www.leanix.net)
item.description: SAP LeanIX with AI can analyze your enterprise architecture diagrams and enable you to populate your information repository with extracted architectural elements. Discover this powerful new EA feature.
